attributes.action: Establish an Annual Public Question Time Day in Parliament
attributes.additional_details: For too long, MPs have dodged real public scrutiny. Many ignore their constituents and rely on staged, filtered debates. This petition demands one day a year where Parliament faces real people—nurses, builders, farmers, teachers—chosen by all parties. 600 citizens. No spin. No hiding. Just answers. It's time the public had a formal seat in Parliament. A day for true democracy, where the people get to speak and the government is forced to listen. Only a non democratic government would deny this.
attributes.background: We call for a yearly Public Question Time Day where 600 everyday citizens—selected by parties in Parliament—can directly question the Prime Minister and Cabinet. No pre-approved scripts. No media filters. No MPs. Real accountability from the people to those in power. Recorded for all to see.

rejection.details:
